basics.name: Cerys Blakemore
basics.label: Senior Software Developer
basics.summary: I have been a Software Developer for 5 years at Sky Betting and Gaming, with being a Senior for 1 year. I have experience with full-stack but have been working predominantly back-end during my time as a senior.

education.area: Digital and Technology Solutions Specialist (Software Engineer Practitioner)

work.summary: Continued to aid with my software development expertise while being more involved in the build up of bringing projects into the wider team.
highlights: Started working in the customer data team with the main project being migrating customers from one stack to another using a variety of APIs and solving a mixture of challenges, such as connecting to databases that involve PCI, Personal Cardholder Information, data.
Heavily involved in the initial creation of tickets from roadmap items given to us from the leadership team.
Took more responsibility in reaching out to other teams and specialists for work required to unblock our team.
The sole point of contact for other teams in lieu of a team leader while working in a senior role. This involved discussion and negotiation around the prioritising and changes of new tickets.
Onboarded multiple new developers, educating and developing them in specific stacks and languages to ensure they have the knowledge required to succeed.
As the foremost senior in the team, I was personally responsible for decisions on software, languages, courses of action, and leadership over various projects.
Volunteered to aid a small team to improve an integrated bot system, which is a vital point of contact between colleagues and wellbeing advisors.

work.summary: Expanded my software developing expertise, working on my soft skills during pair programming while obtaining my AWS and ILM certifications.
highlights: Started working in the onboarding team, focusing on the authentication and verification of customers. This included knowledge of both front and back-end programming techniques.

Primarily coded with React of which I have become proficient, as well as regular work in Java, JavaScript, and Jest. I further have experience through my time in this role with Kafka, Cypress, Kubernetes, Docker, SQL, and YAML.

I have run daily CI pipeline releases through Jenkins, with no issues or bugs noted. Additional to running I have also created multiple Jenkins jobs through Kubernetes to aid in our CI pipeline for new projects.

Personally led projects to ensure technical and product documentation within the team is up to its highest standard to share best practice. Feedback gained from this exercise has been entirely positive, with some of my procedures adapted and spread into other teams.
I have been often driven to take on ambitious tasks and projects where I have worked closely with more knowledgeable team members to improve and expand my knowledge and skillsets.

work.summary: Increased my knowledge within the Salesforce domain while obtaining salesforce admin certifications.
highlights: Continued to improve and utilise knowledge in Salesforce languages previously used as a tech academy graduate.
Was involved in the interviews and process of hiring new graduates to the team on behalf of the business.
Worked closely with new starters to ensure proper training and support as well as improving team cohesion.
Partook and led fortnightly agile meetings including; sprint planning, ticket elaboration, sprint retrospective.
Continued working independently on monthly releases and delivered outcomes to stakeholders.
Raised tech-debt tickets to improve the best practice coding across the business.

work.summary: Help release in live code while going through an apprenticeship-masters programme
highlights: Majority of work was based within Apex, a Salesforce specific Java-based language, of which I have become proficient. I have also worked largely in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. I also attended training for many languages including; Ruby, Kafka, Docker, php, and SQL.
Worked regularly in pair-programming sessions with team members, often leading, to share knowledge and best practice.
Worked closely with team leads to bring in and set requirements for projects, later used to create tickets for the team to work on.
Maintaining all the above whilst simultaneously completing and achieving a Distinction level masterâ€™s degree.
